Shell global

In depth analysis to make sure installation of Shell prelude was done without harming the enviroment.

2017-07-01 00:00:00 +0800 - Broome, Australia

Shipping and Offshore

The in depth analysis was a client requirement to understand the impact of installing the Shell Prelude and to take appropiate measures before the actual positioning
The Shell Prelude was to be installed in an area which is known for its Marine Wildlife but also for its harsh environment. As this is a high level project in terms of cost, media-attention and operational risk. Shell wanted to understand what the impact of the operation would be for the environment in the preparation, sail-away, positioning, operation and de-installation and sail-away.
a detailed enviromental risk assessment was being initiated with consultation groups of each section of the project.
the outcome of the risk assessment was shared with the project-team and in seperate meetings, appropiate measures were taken and communicated. This included selecting green vessels to assist and sourcing tankers with green label. Monitoring systems for bottom, air and water have been sourced.
